summary: Elizabeth Brown Norris was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). The documents available are payroll and certification reports that list her name, salary, and employment dates. She appears in payroll records for April 1978, August 1978, and December 1978. The documents do not specify her exact role within the committee, but her presence on the payroll indicates she was a staff member during the SCAS investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Elizabeth Brown Norris's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS) during its investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of her role is not detailed in these documents, her presence on the payroll indicates her involvement in the committee's work.
